ygData.subject: Re: Starting a paladin
ygData.msgSnippet: No - except maybe if you want to start a trade skill or something like that. When it comes to your actuall Class skills, like combat and magic, you find them
ygData.messageBody:
No - except maybe if you want to start a trade skill or something like that.
When it comes to your actuall "Class" skills, like combat and magic, you
find them maxed for your level by the time you are less than half way to the
next level. (Provided of course you use them, If you dont use a specific
skill, it wont go up). It is possible to power few the first few levels,
but by the time you reach tenth or so it is more than possible to keep all
your skills maxed, provided you have the appropriate equipment.

-----Original Message-----
From: Dragon <dracon@...>
To: eqpaladin@onelist.com <eqpaladin@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, 8 June 1999 21:29
Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Starting a paladin


>From: Dragon <dracon@...>
>
> Will Dwarf's 60 INT makes increment in skill point REAL slow??
